Package edu.ncsu.csc216.stp.model.manager

Class TestPlanManager

java.lang.Object
edu.ncsu.csc216.stp.model.manager.TestPlanManager
public class TestPlanManager extends Object
Contains a list of test plans, the FailingTestList, and operations to manipulate these lists.
Author:
Bryan Phillips, Diego Sarria

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    TestPlanManager()
    The testPlans field is constructed as a SortedList and the failingTestList is constructed and is set as the currentTestPlan.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    addTestCase(TestCase t)
    A TestCase can only be added directly to a TestPlan.

    addTestPlan(String testPlanName)
    Adds a test plan to the list of test plans and updates the current test plan to the new test plan.
    void
    addTestResult(int idx, boolean passing, String actualResult)
    Adds the test result to the test case at the given index in the current test plan.
    void
    clearTestPlans()
    Clears out the TestPlanManager by setting testPlans to an empty SortedList, failingTestList to an empty FailingTestList(), currentTestPlan to the failingTestList, and isChanged to false.

  • Constructor Details

    • TestPlanManager

      public TestPlanManager()
      The testPlans field is constructed as a SortedList and the failingTestList is constructed and is set as the currentTestPlan. isChanged is initialized to false. The clearTestPlans() method can be helpful for completing these tasks.

  • Method Details

    • loadTestPlans

      public void loadTestPlans(File testPlanFile)
      Loads test plans from the file
      Parameters:
      testPlanFile - file to load

    • saveTestPlans

      public void saveTestPlans(File testPlanFile)
      Saves the test plans from the file
      Parameters:
      testPlanFile - file to save

    • isChanged

      public boolean isChanged()
      Checks to see if test plans are changed
      Returns:
      true if test plans are changed and false if not

    • addTestPlan

      public void addTestPlan(String testPlanName)
      Adds a test plan to the list of test plans and updates the current test plan to the new test plan. If the test plan's name is "Failing Tests" or a duplicate then an IllegalArgumentExceptionis thrown.
      Parameters:
      testPlanName - test plan to be added
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - for invalid names

    • getTestPlanNames

      public String[] getTestPlanNames()
      Returns a list of test plan names. The Failing Tests list is always listed first.
      Returns:
      a string array of test plan names

    • setCurrentTestPlan

      public void setCurrentTestPlan(String testPlanName)
      Sets the currentTestPlan to the AbstractTestPlan with the given name. If a TestPlan with that name is not found, then the currentTestPlan is set to the failingTestList
      Parameters:
      testPlanName - name of test

    • getCurrentTestPlan

      public AbstractTestPlan getCurrentTestPlan()
      Gets the current test plan
      Returns:
      AbstractTestPlan

    • editTestPlan

      public void editTestPlan(String testPlanName)
      Edits the current test plan
      Parameters:
      testPlanName - name of test plan
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - for invalid names or if the failing test list is trying to be edited

    • removeTestPlan

      public void removeTestPlan()
      Removes the current test plan and then set to the failing test list
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the current test plan is the failing test list

    • addTestCase

      public void addTestCase(TestCase t)
      A TestCase can only be added directly to a TestPlan. If the currentTestPlan is not a TestPlan do nothing with the TestCase. If the currentTestPlan is a TestPlan, then add the test case and check if the TestCase is failing. If so, then you can update the failingTestList. This is a place where the helper method getFailingTests() can be helpful. isChanged is updated to true.
      Parameters:
      t - TestCase test case to be added

    • addTestResult

      public void addTestResult(int idx, boolean passing, String actualResult)
      Adds the test result to the test case at the given index in the current test plan. If the tests are failing, then the failing test list is updated.
      Parameters:
      idx - index to be added to
      passing - passing status of test result
      actualResult - actual results

    • clearTestPlans

      public void clearTestPlans()
      Clears out the TestPlanManager by setting testPlans to an empty SortedList, failingTestList to an empty FailingTestList(), currentTestPlan to the failingTestList, and isChanged to false.
